titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Joseph Earle Jacobs papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-14T09:51-0800

change.item: July 18, 2017: Revised to add description of materials in box 3 and return declassified materials to original locations in box 1 by Frances Heldt. September 30, 2016: Revised to add increment, box 3. September 12, 2011: Declassified records series added. March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Joseph Earle Jacobs Papers)//EN" "jacobsje.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: Joseph Earle Jacobs papers
did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, reports, and printed matter relating to various aspects of American diplomacy, especially reconstruction in Korea, mutual security programs in Europe after World War II, the Italian communist movement, the Philippine independence movement, and the Shanghai riot of May 30, 1925.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Joseph Earle Jacobs papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1969.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Student interpreter in China and detailed to Peking
American Assessor, International Mixed Court, Shanghai
Judge, Consular Court, District of Shanghai
Technical Adviser to American Commissioner on Extraterritorial Jurisdiction in China
Representative of American Minister to China in negotiations with regard to the Provisional Court, Shanghai
Duty, Far Eastern Division, Department of State
Chief, Office of Philippine Affairs, Department of State
Member, Joint Committee of Experts on Philippine Affairs
Attached to Political Adviser, Allied Headquarters, Mediterranean Command, Caserta, Italy
Political Adviser to the Commanding General in Korea
Adviser, Far Eastern Affairs, 3rd session of the General Assembly of the United Nations, Paris
Awarded Patriotic Civilian Service Medal by Department of the Army
Minister to American Embassy, Rome - special assistant for Mutual Defense Assistant Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Writings, correspondence, reports, and printed matter relating to various aspects of American diplomacy, especially reconstruction in Korea, mutual security programs in Europe after World War II, the Italian communist movement, the Philippine independence movement, and the Shanghai riot of May 30, 1925.

did.unittitle: Political Adviser to the Commanding General in Korea file
Press release on Korea and the Soviet Union,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes two newspaper clippings, one in Korean.

did.unittitle: U.S. Foreign Service reports on Syngman Rhee, the establishment of the Korean government, etc.
"Intimate Report on Syngman Rhee" (8 pp.),
Syngman Rhee to John R. Hodge (3 pp.),
Memorandum (2 pp.),
Memorandum, re arrival of Douglas MacArthur (3 pp.),
Press release, Rhee address (4 pp.),
Press release, MacArthur address (2 pp.),
Press release, Gen. John Hodge's remarks (3 pp.),
Speech of H.E. Ambassador Liu Yu-wan (1 p.),
Address of Rev. P. J. Byrne (2 pp.),

"The Spirit of Korean Chivalry,"

Despatches, memoranda, and printed matter,
Memorandum for General Wedemeyer, subject: "Comments on Memorandum dated July 15, 1947,"

Memorandum for General Wedemeyer, subject: "Recommendations With Regard to Korea,"

Memorandum, subject: "Concert for the American Delegation,"

Despatches No. 1028, 1029, to the State Department, (4 pp. each),
Despatches No. 961, 962, to the State Department (9 pp., 8 pp.),
Despatches No. 923, No. 924, to the State Department (4 pp. each),

U.S. Foreign Service, No. 102, subject: "Visit to Seoul of Underseer of Army, Wm. H. Draper,"

Telephone directory, Greater Seoul Area,
Communism in Italy, embassy reports and printed matter,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a preliminary report on the VII Congress of the Italian Communist Party and a map of Italy showing communist areas.

did.unittitle: Joint Committee in the Philippines, report and press release (5 pp.),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a press release of 1939 August 7 regarding the bill to amend the Philippine Independence Act.

did.unittitle: Netherland India
Tourist booklets and guides,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Titles include "A Short Guide to the Boro-Budur," "Dutch East Indies, Indo-China, Malaya, Siam," "Tourist Map: Bali and the Idjen-Highland," "The Best of Java," "Sumatra," "Bali," and "Handbook of Information and Intended Time Table: K.P.M. Line."

did.unittitle: Tourist booklets and guides,
International Mixed Court, Shanghai, trial,
Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mainly personal correspondence documenting Jacobs' various appointments with in the Department of State. Includes a series of letters relating to his forced resignation as Ambassador to Czechoslovakia by President Truman and correspondence with friend Alger Hiss.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper clipping from the Manila Daily Bulletin, 1940 September 10.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper clipping in Czech, 1948 December 19.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper clipping from the New York Times, 1949 June 16.

did.unittitle: Official orders,
Material related to U.S. involvement in China,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, memoranda on judicial procedure, 1922 congressional resolution and presidential proclamation, 1921 executive order, 1915 booklet titled "Outlines of the System of Civil Government in China," and newspaper clippings.

did.unittitle: Congressional report and act,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report of the Sixtieth Congress, Session II, and "An Act Relative to the Naturalization and Citizenship of Married Women."

did.unittitle: "Reports on the Peculiarities of Consular Service Work in China Under Extraterritoriality," report and correspondence,
Obituaries,
